intro: Rubus malinvaudii, commonly known as the Malinvaud’s blackberry, is a species of bramble native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark red to black berries that are typically harvested in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
